title: How can one get admission for class 6 under rural reservation policy in JNV if studying in Kendriya Vidyalaya? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is only possible if your KV is situated in a rural area. Otherwise, it will be illegal for you to get admission under rural quota. The policy is clear. Residence doesn't determine rural or urban status. Rather, it is the location of the school which determines it. Further, all the preceding three years before admission must be spent in a rural area. Otherwise, you will be considered an urban candidate.

The school(KV) in which you've completed your 3,4 and 5th standard should come under rural area. Then you'll get it easily. I have seen people from urban area attending the exam by enrolling to one of the rural area private/public schools and availing the fake certificate. Which is against policy.
